snippet: The water and wind of Hurricane Sandy destroyed nearly half of the homes on Kissam Avenue on Staten Island, and flooded the rest.
abstract: Residents of Kissan Avenue on Staten Island discover that the very qualities that made the place so attractive, like its proximity to water and quiet isolation, made it vulnerable to Hurricane Sandy's destructive power; all that remains of about a dozen homes on the street are concrete foundations and gaping cellars surrounded by blossoms of mildewed belongings (Series: Coming Back).
lead_paragraph: The water and wind of Hurricane Sandy destroyed nearly half of the homes on Kissam Avenue on Staten Island, and flooded the rest.

headline.seo: On a Staten Island Avenue, At Home Again, but Only to Mourn
headline.main: Home Again, but Only to Mourn
headline.print_headline: At Home Again, but Only to Mourn
